message_1: Let f(z) = z^3 - 2z^2 + 3z - 4 be an analytic function on the complex plane. Find the value of f(i), where i is the imaginary unit.
message_2:
To find the value of f(i), we simply substitute i for z in the given function:

f(i) = (i)^3 - 2(i)^2 + 3(i) - 4

Recall that i^2 = -1 and i^3 = -i. Now, we can simplify the expression:

f(i) = (-i) - 2(-1) + 3(i) - 4
f(i) = -i + 2 + 3i - 4
f(i) = 2i - 2

So, the value of f(i) is 2i - 2.
